node.title: Heavy rain to move over South Island's West Coast, holidaymakers warned
node.description: MetService has issued heavy rain warnings.
node.content: ["Holidaymakers on the South Island's western coast can expect plenty of rain during the next day.\n", "Westland about and south of Arthur's Pass has had a heavy rain warning in place since 1am through until 5pm on Monday.", "In Westland north of Arthur's Pass, a heavy rain watch is in place from 9am until 1am on Tuesday morning.", "And MetService has issued a heavy rain watch for Buller south of Karamea from Monday night until 6am on Tuesday.", "Rain is expected to accumulate about the ranges and driving conditions may be hazardous in some areas.", "MetService is advising people to keep up to date with the latest forecasts in case further areas are added.", "Meteorologist Tui McInnes said a cold front was making its way slowly up the country.", "However, McInnes said the warning was not unusual for this time of year.", "Trampers are warned rain is expected to accumulate about the ranges.", "RNZ"]
